Reviews.Title: “Close to train station, free parking”
Reviews.Author: laxslc
Reviews.Content: We were passing through by car so this hotel worked out very well in that the parking was easy and free, yet the location was still close to town and the train station. The walk into town was about 15-20 minutes, or the hotel has bikes that you can use. The bikes were all checked out when we arrived so if you know you want to use them it is best to reserve them in advance. The room wasn't anything fancy but the hotel was clean and acceptable for a 2 or 3 star type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Train Station, Waterbus stop and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: fancy2011
Reviews.Content: Stay in fist weekend of October 2011. This Hotel is very convenient to move around Venice because the Waterbus stop is close by and train Station. Many shops and restaurants right outside the the alley ....... Good Location! It is a bit difficult to see right off the main (Lista di Spagna) street because the entrance is off an Alley ...(take note of that) We had to ask around in order to find it .... The rooms are very small, and much smaller the bathroom.... The walls of the restroom were duty, like with mildew, rust, and paint chipping. Beds some what hard. Breakfast is only coffee and bread!!!! oh, and some jelly! Other, Note ... You need to leave your room key at the front desk every time you leave the hotel... The front desk people really don't speak English. We were lucky because they spoke better in Spanish which we know. This hotel is very very basic!!!! There is no TV, no radio, no elevator. You get what you pay for... It was the less expense we found in Venice for a group of 8 people!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but comfortable near Santa Lucia train station”
Reviews.Author: Beingnotdoing
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Venice and I learnt the hard way that it is a good idea to pick a hotel near to the train station if you have luggage! This hotel meets this requirement. The hotel is cheap for Venetian standards but the value for money is not so good compared to other cities. A full breakfast was advertised when I booked. What was provided was very far from that - two bread rolls, jam, coffee and juice. The room was small but okay. The shared bathroom was not so good. Poor water pressure and not much of a barrier between the shower and the rest of the room. In terms of location I would recommend this hotel however some simple adjustments need to be made to service and maintenance before recommending overall.

Reviews.Title: “Location, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: GrandCayman
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Rossi, Venice for 3 nights in September 2011. This was the worst hotel on our 2-week stay in Italy. The only thing we liked about the hotel was its location, just steps away from the Venice train station and the Grand Canal. Upon arrival, we immediately felt uneasy because of the hotel's appearance (dirty carpet, cramped, dusty, smoky) but we had been traveling all day and had no desire to go elsewhere. We each had a check-in bag - mine unfortunately was 60lbs - and the guy at the counter was rude and told us the hotel didn't have an elevator. We were on the 3rd floor! He eventually helped us but we had to help him too and by the time we got to our room we were completely drenched in sweat. He didn't take us to our room either and we had to figure everything out on our own. The room was dirty and cramped with cots for beds. We had a private bathroom but it was so teeny and the toilet always backed up giving off a sewage smell. Breakfast was the biggest joke of all - hard rolls and jam and coffee or tea. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice room but many people share one toilet”
Reviews.Author: Joycesiaw
Reviews.Content: i chose a double room with shared bathroom. mind you, if you are taking shared bathroom rooms, all are located on the 3rd floor. if you have many luggages, you might wanna think twice. but i didnt mind lugging so its okay. my room was very villa-ish. not very big, jus right for two persons. toilet is two rooms away, i think many are sharing one toilet so someitmes have to wait to use the bathroom. breakfast was a drink with 2 italian baguettes (small). its quite strategic, once u walk out from the hotel, there's a busy tourist street, many stalls selling souvenirs. but from here to get to st mark's basilica, you'll need to take a water bus ride, about 20mins from here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gaugin-100
Reviews.Content: My single room in this hotel was the smallest hotel room that I have ever seen. My room was very dusty and had obviously not been properly cleaned for a long time. The curtain was a piece of cloth pushed into the wall. I must say that the staff were very friendly but the breakfast was awful. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good basic room, good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: CMG_CMG
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that my husband and I stayed here, and we still found it to be a good value for a very expensive city. It's conveniently located near the train station, so you don't have to drag your bags all over the city and up and down stairs. Both times we stayed on the first floor. The rooms were small but comfortable and clean, and the bathrooms were tiny, but clean and usable. Since the hotel is at the end of a small alley, it's fairly quiet. The breakfast is very basic, but the coffee is good and the rolls are fresh, so that was fine by us. If you're looking for a place to comfortably sleep and shower, then this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal no frills base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Stephane
Reviews.Content: Qiuet location off busy thoroughfare near to Grand Canal. Very handy for bus & train stations but always has a surprisingly peaceful, tucked away feel - reached through a charming ancient archway. Room (we had 101) basic double with small en suite shower/sink/wc - very clean. Retro fit aircon and ceiling fan though we didn;t need them. Room made and towels changed daily. Breakfast simple continental - bread rolls/jam/coffee/"fruit" jiuce, service rather perfunctory. Desk service friendly though not particularly engaging. Overall good value for money and absolutely ideal for th9se wanting a simple base.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: bkhess
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at the Hotel Rossi. I gave my parents the room on the second floor and we took a room on the 3rd. My parentâ€™s room was large and had a nice large bathroom. Our room was a fine size but the bathroom was smaller than a cruise ship bathroom. I did not mind, but my husband did not care for the tiny shower. The rooms were very clean and well maintained for a very old building. I really enjoyed watching the apartments across the ally from us. It was great to watch locals going about every day life, hanging their laundry and cooking. I know, it sounds nosey. The small ally that this hotel is down is very small and easy to miss, so you have to pay attention the first time you look for it, but it is very quiet at night. The hotel is very close to the bus and train station which is why we picked it. We did not want to carry our luggage too far. It is a very convenient location. The staff was very nice, I donâ€™t think they spoke much English, but it was not a problem. This was the cheapest place we found to buy bottled water at â‚¬1 a piece so the man at the front desk had one waiting for us each afternoon when we came back. As far as amenities, yes, it is basic, but it is great value for the price. My Mom would go down in the morning to borrow the blow drier and then I would come down to use it on the way to breakfast. We never had a problem getting it. We all enjoyed the breakfast. Drinks were hot cocoa, coffee and water. The 2 guys mixed the coffee and cocoa for a mocha type drink that they enjoyed. Our table was given a huge basket of crusty rolls with butter and different jams. It was simple but they were the best rolls ever. Straight out of the bakerâ€™s paper bag, Yum. It was more than enough to tide us over until lunch. I would love to stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: igorspit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rossi for a few days in December and enjoyed a lot. The hotel position is excellent in a small private street away from the crowd, very near to the railways station and close to the waterbuses pier , the room was not so large but clean and comfortable, breakfast good even if essential, friendly staff and reasonable price for Venice. For a future visit in this wonderful city weâ€™ll surely stay at the Rossi again.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic, clean and quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ptrme
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rossi is a 'budget hotel' by Venice standards. I did a lot of research before booking this Hotel and this came recommended from a friend who had stayed there a year before. The room was small but big enough. Could have been bigger if it did not have so much unnecessary furniture. It was very quiet. We choose a ground floor room because we were travelling with a baby and did not want to carry a pram and luggage upstairs. The breakfast was basic but fine and a good way to start the day. The woman who served the breakfast was very very nice. The front desk staff were a bit cool but ok. The Hotel is very conveniently located. I would recommend to others travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay*******”
Reviews.Author: hollyoaks
Reviews.Content: Where to begin Room was horrible away from hotel through a dingy appartment complex Breakfast was terrible by any standards This has to be one of the worst places I have ever stayed. The price might be low but so not worth it..........................

Reviews.Title: “It's gone off”
Reviews.Author: acmejc
Reviews.Content: I last reviewed Rossi in 2003 and have stayed there several times over the years. I will NOT be staying there again. After reserving some time in advance we were given one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in. We asked to to be moved and were moved, to a room on the top floor. The lack of service was somewhat breathtaking - kind of "who cares?" We moved to another, cheaper [and better] hotel and at checkout from Rossi discovered a new arrival was getting a better room for less than we paid, because they dropped in. What's the point of reserving!? I understand that the Hotel has changed hands in the recent few years. This is a terrible shame - Rossi was a favourite hotel once-upon-a-time, but now, never again

Reviews.Title: “my disaster of a time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: quebec27
Reviews.Content: We went to Hotel Rossi because I had been there 9 years ago and loved it. It is close to everything and clean. That is about it. The former owners have since sold it about a year ago and it is not the same place. Our room was so small we could not find a place to put our luggage on the floor. There was no fridge, no safe, the shower head did not stay up ,no blow dryer and no customer service. The breakfast that was provided was a coffee, bread roll, butter and jam.That is it!! It was so bad we ended up leaving a day earlier than plan planned and even aboured the lose of 95 euros for that night. That is how upset we were. I had made my reservation in March and got the worst service ever.Not recommended at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Safe and friendly hotel in great position.”
Reviews.Author: UgglaOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Rossi with my two young sons for four nights. The best thing is its proximity to the Train Station and Vaporetto stops. Much easier to comfortably walk from train straight to hotel in 5 mins, dump bags and then go exploring Venice, than to heave bags on and off the boats or up and down bridges to hotels farther afield. The hotel is at the end of a beautiful courtyard and very quiet. Lovely staff and clean rooms. Tiny bathroom, but quite adequate. Cheap restaurants nearby. Excellent gelati stall right opposite archway. Easy to walk to and from San Marco and Rialto or to catch vaporetti. Supermarket not too far away. No lift though.

Reviews.Title: “good location, okay room and stale bread for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LoriJamcan
Reviews.Content: the only thing good about Hotel Rossi is its location close to the train station down a little street and so it was quiet. No matter what you couldn't get lost as the direction indicators on the walls in Venice always indicated either the way to the station or San Marco square. The breakfast was stale bread and jam/honey /butter and reasonably decent coffee in a tight little room. The room we slept in was never swept...dust balls accumulated under the bed in our 4 night stay. Only stairs to get up to the floors. The cot for our teenage son was uncomfortable. Fortunately we rarely spent anytime there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: gkozocas
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. You are steps away from the grand canal, great restuarants, and transportation (the train station, and boats). The rooms are average, breakfast below average, but for the price you can't beat it. Perfect for a short stay and easy to get to if you have luggage to carry around..great stay..

Reviews.Title: “My Third Stay”
Reviews.Author: edosh
Reviews.Content: This was my third time that i have stayed in Hotel Rossi.Ä°t's a clean and a cheap hotel in Venice.The rooms are very small,the breakfast is ok,the staff was helpful.Ä°t's in Canareggio so to go to the center , San Marco,you need to walk 20 minutes but it's not a problem in Venice because to discover the city you need to walk. Also it's very close to train and bus station.That's why i prefer to stay.5minutes to the train station,10 minutes to bus station by walk. Ä° have searched a lot but couldn' find more cheapest hotel than Hotel Rossi.The restaurants in Venice is expensive there is a food court very close to Hotel Rossi.The food is delicious-and costless. For my forth stay i can stay in Hotel rossi again:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtv28
Reviews.Content: Great value for a no frills room. We had a one night stay and I couldn't be happier. Had to get up the following morning and hit Piazzale Roma to get to the airport so location was perfect. The room we had faced a courtyard so it was nice and quiet. If we were there for a longer stay, I might look for something else. This is not the best place if you plan on spending a lot of time IN the room however, you're in Venice so that shouldn't be too much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend for couples with young babies”
Reviews.Author: NewZealanderinLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Rossi with our 6 month year old baby. The hotel is a great location but a very average hotel. We paid 112 euros for a double room. The hotel has no lift so we had to carry the pram up three sets of stairs. We asked the hotel if we could get some boiling water for our babies formula, the receptionist took us to the coffee machine, showed us it was off and said we couldn't use it until 7.30am the next morning and that the room was locked. We found the staff particularly unfriendly and unhelpful. The rooms are very very basic but clean. The breakfast is very basic, 4 bread rolls and jam and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, Very close to train station”
Reviews.Author: omelete01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing out of the ordinary. The rooms were kind of small, but that is expected in Italy. I have certainly seen smaller rooms. The bathroom in the single room was also tiny. But the shared bathroom was much larger and also very clean. Breakfast was ok, nothing great. The best thing about the hotel was that it was pretty cheap for Venice and it was very close to the train station (5 minutes at most). Staff spoke English well.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Venice”
Reviews.Author: weezer-85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while in Venice. Excellent location and very easy to find from the train station which is a godsend in a city where getting lost is all too easy and more than likely to happen. Staff are friendly and helpful although it was a little annoying when we had to wait 10 minutes to be checked out at the end of our stay because the staff member was chatting away on the phone, while we wished to be catching a train. Room was simple but clean as was the shared bathroom, which wasn't a problem to use as the hotel was not too busy. Breakfast was great. One gripe would be the 3 flights of stairs we had to climb in order to get to our room. Wouldnt reccomend for young children, those with disabilities or even the unfit! But very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Missusken
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rossi is a good old place. Nothing fancy but friendly and a great location. Breakfast is rolls,biscuits and coffee or tea,no arguments. But there is a certain charm. We were on a six week European holiday from Australia and the Rossi suited us fine. Two adults and two boys aged 3 and four. Staff were friendly and helpful. If I had a negative it would be the water pressure in the shower, but you cope.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't go there again”
Reviews.Author: TheophaniaSeattle
Reviews.Content: The good things about Hotel Rossi--very near the train station and a very good price for Venice. The rooms are basic but totally fine and the beds were comfortable. A breakfast of coffee, bread and jam is included. The front desk people were generally helpful with inquiries about how to get around the city. But everything else about our stay was a comedy of errors and even though I wouldn't say "don't stay at Hotel Rossi," I probably won't reward them with my business again. I contacted the hotel in December about a 3 night stay in May. We requested a single room with two beds and they confirmed our reservation. When we arrived we were told that they did not have the room we requested. They explained that the mix up was because I had booked so far in advance! Something about how they don't actually open till March. As best as I understood it, they just replied 'yes' to me and to other guests, and then figured they'd work out the details later, when they opened. Unsurprisingly, it didn't all work out. Since they were going to give us 2 rooms for the first night (at the originally agreed upon price) and then switch us to our originally requested room, I didn't make a big deal about it. But I was awfully annoyed with the repeated statements "you see it is not our fault." Because I actually don't see that and I certainly don't want to hear it over and over again. So they gave us two rooms on the 3rd and 4th floors. The 4th floor room was incredibly small and there was no bathroom on that floor at all. But even that we could have dealt with if the room itself weren't the temperature of a sauna. At first we thought it was just because it was a warm day so we opened the window as wide as possible. But then I realized the heater was warm. We called down to the front desk to ask if there was any way it could be on and how we could turn it off. No, we were told that the heat was not on. As we left for dinner, we encouraged him to check out the room--it was truly unbearably hot. He said he would of course check, but that of course the heat was not on. When we came back there was a different person at the desk and the room was just as hot. You truly could not sleep there. We didn't feel like dealing with the front desk so we just so we moved everything back to the other room and dealt with the single bed. On our way out for the day we told them we couldn't sleep in the room and received a shrug in response. Only when we returned later did he tell us that yes, it turns out we were right. The boiler was broken and stuck in the "on" position. But it was Sunday so there probably wouldn't be any repairs that day. We let it go because we were being moved to a different room. Although that one wound up being quite warm as well, we were just happy to be in our originally requested room at last. After a long day of walking and sight seeing, we went back to our rooms to relax. A couple of hours later I was just starting to fall asleep (admittedly early but it was probably around 10 pm) when the phone rang and woke me up. The reception desk wanted to know how many days we were staying. Were we leaving tomorrow? No, we told them we intended to stay three nights--as we arranged when we made our reservations! Why were they calling us at 10 pm when they saw us retire to our room 2 hours before (and they did see us because they keep all room keys at the front desk)? I was starting to feel that Hotel Rossi was determined I not sleep soundly and comfortably in their establishment. The next night, Monday, the boiler still wasn't fixed. But the windows and the ceiling fan and an evening rain kept us cool enough. When we paid I kind of wanted to hassle the management for a discount but I just didn't have the energy. They certainly didn't offer any discounts. There are lots of reasons for people to stay at Hotel Rossi. I doubt all the things that went wrong with our stay are likely to repeat for anyone else. But even though I'm a pretty forgiving traveler, I have to say I would have to be pretty desperate to give them a 2nd chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, at a great price for Venice”
Reviews.Author: tip_the_canoe
Reviews.Content: Location: For Venice, my boyfriend and I found this place to be in a great location if you want to be close to the train station - it's about a 5 min walk. However, if you want to stay close to the attractions, it's quite a bit further, about a 20 min walk (at least). Staff: The reception staff was always polite and friendly. However, the woman who served us breakfast was very strange; she literally stood at the door and stared at us the ENTIRE time. Cleanliness: No complaints. Rooms: Comfortable enough, though ours was a bit cramped. Breakfast: Horrible, a few stale rolls and terrible coffee. Value: Excellent, at 65 Euro, we feel this was a great deal for Venice. Overall, this was a good choice for us, because we weren't willing to pay much for our one night in Venice - we knew we'd hardly even be in the room. But if you're looking for more than a bed (or good breakfast) - go somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rossi
HotelInfo.Address: Lista di Spagna, 262 | Cannaregio, 30121 Venice, Italy
